articles.author: David Swanson
articles.description: Violent clashes erupted early on Wednesday morning on the campus of the University of California in Los Angeles between pro-Palestinian protesters and a group of counter-demonstrators supporting Israel.
articles.title: UCLA campus protests over Gaza war erupt into violent clashes between rival groups

articles.author: Brendan Pierson, Jack Queen
articles.description: Harvey Weinstein is due to appear in state court in Manhattan on Wednesday for the first time since New York's highest court threw out his 2020 rape conviction last week.
articles.title: Harvey Weinstein expected in New York court after rape conviction overturned

articles.author: Patricia Zengerle
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden's administration faced renewed pressure on Wednesday from his fellow Democrats to influence Israel not to launch a full-scale invasion of Rafah, the city where almost half of the Gaza Strip's 2.3 million people have taken refuge.
articles.title: US Democrats press Biden to prevent Israeli assault on Rafah

articles.author: Jonathan Landay, Daphne Psaledakis
articles.description: The United States on Wednesday accused Russia of violating the international chemical weapons ban by deploying the choking agent chloropicrin against Ukrainian troops and using riot control agents "as a method of warfare" in Ukraine.
articles.title: Russia breached global chemical weapons ban in Ukraine war, US says

articles.author: Brendan Pierson
articles.description: A federal judge has struck down parts of a North Carolina law restricting patients' access to the abortion pill mifepristone, which has become the subject of legal battles nationwide.
articles.title: US judge blocks some North Carolina restrictions on abortion pill

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel's state auditor on Wednesday called on Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and the head of the armed forces to cooperate with an official investigation into how Hamas was able to stage the Oct. 7 attack on Israel that sparked the Gaza war.
articles.title: Israel state watchdog calls on Netanyahu, military chief to cooperate in Oct. 7 probe

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Floods and landslides across Kenya have killed 179 people since March, with hundreds of thousands forced to leave their homes, the government said on Wednesday, as dozens more were killed in neighbouring Tanzania and Burundi.
articles.title: Kenya flood toll rises to 179 as homes and roads are destroyed
Georgian lawmakers tussle in parliament after crackdown on foreign agent protesters

articles.author: Greg Torode
articles.description: A senior U.S. official on Thursday urged China and Russia to match declarations by the United States and others that only humans, and never artificial intelligence, would make decisions on deploying nuclear weapons.
articles.title: US official urges China, Russia to declare only humans, not AI, control nuclear weapons

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Tens of thousands of people marched in Colombia's biggest cities on Wednesday to support reforms proposed by President Gustavo Petro which he says will tackle inequality, but which have struggled to win congressional approval.
articles.title: Tens of thousands of Colombians march in support of Petro's reforms
